page.title: 08Woodlands school Durris
page.content: Our school is in the Parish of Durris.It is quite a small school,and takes children from age 5 to 12.At the moment there are 37 pupils and two teachers.The school was built in 1876,and a new part added on in 1979,because of lack of space.We have a tarmac playground and no grass.The older pupils are taught in the newer part of the school and the younger ones in the original part.We get specialist teachers to help us.On Monday we get music,on Tuesday the P.6 and 7 pupils get swimming,and there is an open session in the evening.On Wednesday the minister comes and we get gym. On Thursday afternoon we have art and on Friday,home economics in the morning and football and netball in the afternoon. We have two pet fish,some stick insects and a rabbit.
